intro: Luzula spicata, commonly known as spike rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Juncaceae. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and cylindrical inflorescence that bears small, spike-like clusters of flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or wetland habitats. Luzula spicata has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, greenish-brown flowers that are wind-pollinated. It is often used in ornamental gardening for its upright growth habit and ability to thrive in shady conditions.
